meanings.definition: The first letter of the Hebrew alphabet.
meanings.sent1: In Hebrew class, we learned about the alephs.
meanings.sent2: The teacher wrote the alephs on the board for us to see.
meanings.sent3: The alephs decided to have a race to see who would be first.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to learn the alephs was as strong as the first light of dawn.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scrolls were filled with the mysterious beauty of the alephs.

meanings.definition: Plural form of aleph, referring to the first letter of the Hebrew alphabet.
meanings.sent1: The book explained the significance of the alephs in Hebrew culture.
meanings.sent2: She carefully studied the alephs in the ancient texts.
meanings.sent3: The alephs on the page seemed to dance in a joyful celebration.
meanings.sent4: The unity of the alephs symbolized the strength of the community.
meanings.sent5: The calligraphy of the alephs was a work of art in itself.
